source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves pinnatisect, green above, white-tomentose beneath; widespread annual (rarely perennial)
Leaves entire, toothed, or with a pair of small basal lobes, white or grey-tomentose on both surfaces; coastal perennial
Annual, never rooting at nodes; disc florets black; cypselas woolly; pappus of small scales
Perennial, rooting at nodes; disc florets yellow; cypselas glabrous or somewhat hairy but never woolly; pappus absent
